awd_titl_txt: MERIF: A Forum for CISE-supported Midscale Experimental Research Infrastructure projects Projects
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
MERIF, the Midscale Experimental Research infrastructrure Forum was created to supporrt collaboration and communication among the varoius CISE supported MERI projects, The prrimary activity was in the form of Workshops. Because of the COVID Pandemic and the resulting difficulty in holding face-to-face meetings, the planned thrree year timeframe required several extensions,

The first Workshop was held at GWU  in Washington DC. In addition to a few overview talks, the primary activity involved tutorrials where the MERIs descrribed their facilities and how these could be used for experimental research. Attendees were mostly faculty who wished to use these facilities for their teaching and research. An efforrt was made to include faculty from HBUCs and MSIs.

A second Workshop was held at FIU in Miami Floirida, The goal of this Workshop was to idenfify new areas for MERIs with particular emphasis on interdisciplinary collaborations, Among the areas discussed were Synthetic Biology and Quantum Computing,  In additionm, the existing MERIs reported on their status,

The thrid Wokshop was held at UW in Maidison Wisconsin. This was the first postpandemic Workshop and primarily involved project status resports plus reports on notable rresearch conducted using the funded MERIs,

The final Workshop was held at BU in Boston Massachusetts, The Workshop  focused on project status, notable research enabled by the MERIs and future plans

Full deails of the Workshops and other MERIF related activities can be found at MERIF.org ,
